form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To authorize the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department of Homeland Security to hold an annual cybersecurity competition relating to offensive and defensive cybersecurity disciplines, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the President’s Cup Cybersecurity Competition Act.

subsection.text: The Director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (in this section referred to as the Director) of the Department of Homeland Security is authorized to hold an annual cybersecurity competition to be known as the Department of Homeland Security Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency’s President’s Cup Cybersecurity Competition (in this section referred to as the competition) for the purpose of identifying, challenging, and competitively awarding prizes, including cash prizes, to the United States Government’s best cybersecurity practitioners and teams across offensive and defensive cybersecurity disciplines.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding section 1342 of title 31, United States Code, the Director, in carrying out the competition, may consult with, and consider advice from, any person who has experience or expertise in the development, design, or execution of cybersecurity competitions.
The Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) shall not apply to consultations pursuant to this section.
A person with whom the Director consults under paragraph (1) may not—

subparagraph.text: receive pay by reason of being so consulted; or
be considered an employee of the Federal Government by reason of so consulting.

subsection.text: To be eligible to participate in the competition, an individual shall be a Federal civilian employee or member of the uniformed services (as such term is defined in section 2101(3) of title 5, United States Code) and shall comply with any rules promulgated by the Director regarding the competition.

The Director may enter into a grant, contract, cooperative agreement, or other agreement with a private sector for-profit or nonprofit entity or State or local government agency to administer the competition.
Each competition shall incorporate the following elements:

paragraph.text: Cybersecurity skills outlined in the National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education Framework, or any successor framework.

Categories demonstrating offensive and defensive cyber operations, such as software reverse engineering and exploitation, network operations, forensics, big data analysis, cyber analysis, cyber defense, cyber exploitation, secure programming, obfuscated coding, or cyber-physical systems.
Any other elements related to paragraphs (1), (2), or (3) as determined necessary by the Director.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Director may use amounts made available to the Director for the competition for the following:

subparagraph.text: Advertising, marketing, and promoting the competition.
Meals for participants and organizers of the competition if attendance at the meal during the competition is necessary to maintain the integrity of the competition.
Promotional items, including merchandise and apparel.
Monetary and nonmonetary awards for competition participants, including members of the uniformed services.
Necessary expenses for the honorary recognition of competition participants, including members of the uniformed services.
Any other appropriate activity necessary to carry out the competition, as determined by the Director.

paragraph.text: This subsection shall apply to amounts appropriated on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.text: The Director may make one or more awards per competition, except that the amount or value of each shall not exceed $10,000. The Secretary of Homeland Security may make one or more awards per competition, except the amount or the value of each shall not to exceed $25,000. A monetary award under this section shall be in addition to the regular pay of the recipient.

The Director shall annually provide to the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate a report that includes the following:

paragraph.text: A description of available funds under subsection (f) for each competition conducted in the preceding year.
A description of expenditures authorized in subsection (g) for each competition.
Information relating to the participation of each competition.

Information relating to lessons learned from each competition and how such lessons may be applied to improve cybersecurity operations and recruitment of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency of the Department of Homeland Security.
